title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 606.95 - Cause for revocation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 606.95 - Cause for revocation

State Regulations
(a) The following shall constitute sufficient
cause for the board to cancel and revoke any permit: (1)
any violation of, or failure to comply
with, any of the rules and regulations of the board, including SEQR procedures
adopted by the board pursuant to article 8 of the New York State Environmental

Conservation Law; (2)
any violation
of, or failure to comply with, any rule, regulation or law, either local, State
or Federal, applicable thereto; or
(3)
any other cause or reason deemed by the
board to be sufficient. (b) The board shall by resolution determine
the matter of the cancellation and revocation of any permit, with or without
notice or hearing, excepting as in section
606.96
of this Part otherwise
provided, and thereupon such permit shall be declared cancelled and
revoked. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
606.95

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
